snippet: Databases offer a trove of medical information, without the cost of clinical research trials.
abstract: Chief goal of federal regulations nudging hospitals and medical offices around the country to electronic records has been to improve efficiency and cut costs; additional powerful incentive that has gone less noticed is that electronic medical records may benefit medical research, potentially turning patients into participants in a vast, ongoing clinical trial; use of records may also help scientists avoid rising costs of research.
lead_paragraph: Databases offer a trove of medical information, without the cost of clinical research trials.

headline.main: Mining Electronic Records for Revealing Health Data
headline.print_headline: Mining Electronic Records for Revealing Health Data
